EcmaScript6 Examples - overrides

EcmaScript 6 allows to override methods when a class inherit another.

Let's see an example: 

                
                    class Person{
                        constructor(name){
                            this._name = name;
                        }

                        get name(){
                            return this._name;
                        }

                        set name(value){
                            this._name = value;
                        }
                    }

                    class Employee extends Person{
                        constructor(title, name){
                            super(name);
                            this._title = title;
                        }

                        get title(){
                            return this._title;
                        }

                        doWork(){
                            return `${this._name} is working.`;
                        }
                    }

                    class Manager extends Employee{
                        constructor(name){
                            super('Manager',name);
                        }

                        doWork(){
                            return `${this._name} is managing.`;
                        }
                    }

                    let employee = new Employee('Developer', 'Rodrigo');

                    employee.title; //=> Developer
                    employee.name; //=> Rodrigo
                    employee.doWork(); //=> Rodrigo is working;

                    let manager = new Manager('Carlos');

                    manager.title; //=> Manager
                    manager.name; //=> Carlos
                    manager.doWork(); //=> Carlos is managing.

Overriding a method is possible to change its behaviour, and the method can do a different thing of inherited method. 

                
                    class Person{
                        constructor(name){
                            this._name = name;
                        }

                        get name(){
                            return this._name;
                        }

                        set name(value){
                            this._name = value;
                        }
                    }

                    class Employee extends Person{
                        constructor(title, name){
                            super(name);
                            this._title = title;
                        }

                        get title(){
                            return this._title;
                        }

                        doWork(){
                            return `${this._name} is working.`;
                        }

                        getSalary(){
                            return 12000;
                        }
                    }

                    class Manager extends Employee{
                        constructor(name){
                            super('Manager',name);
                        }

                        doWork(){
                            return `${this._name} is managing.`;
                        }

                        getSalary(){
                            let salary = super.getSalary();
                            return salary + (salary * 0.15);
                        }
                    }

                    let employee = new Employee('Developer', 'Rodrigo');

                    employee.title; //=> Developer
                    employee.name; //=> Rodrigo
                    employee.doWork(); //=> Rodrigo is working;
                    employee.getSalary(); //=> 12000

                    let manager = new Manager('Carlos');

                    manager.title; //=> Manager
                    manager.name; //=> Carlos
                    manager.doWork(); //=> Carlos is managing.
                    manager.getSalary(); //=> 13800

Sometimes just override a method isn't enough, so is possible using the same method after keyword "super" to execute the method from superclass and execute additional code.
